material-property-value-condition.content:
Please analyze the following paragraph and summarize the properties, including their numerical values, of the mentioned materials.

Paragraph: BHJ PSCs with PffBBn : PC71BM active blend layer spin - coated at different temperatures showed considerably various photovoltaic performance because of the morphological order change of the blend layer at different processing temperatures. Among PffBBn : PC71BM - based PSCs fabricated , PffBB-14 with strongest aggregation strength / behavior exhibited the most promising photovoltaic performance , with a maximum PCE of 9.93% , a large V oc of 0.92 V , a J sc of 16.77 mA cm^-2 , and a FF of 64.36% . Such a superior device efficiency was attributed to the greatly enhanced exciton dissociation , higher and balanced charge carrier mobilities , and less recombination losses in the active layer of the PffBB-14:PC71BM - based cells. Our results demonstrated that the modulation of aggregation behavior through structural modification and temperature tuning could effectively optimize the physical and optoelectronic properties of a material and device for solar cell applications . Synthesis and Physical Properties of Polymers. The PffBB-n ( n = 10 , 12 , 14 , or 16 ) polymers were synthesized according to the optimized literature procedures and the synthetic scheme is shown in Scheme 1.^39 The Corey - House synthesis of 3-bromothiophene and oxalyl dichloride gave 1,2di(thiophen-3-yl)ethane-1,2-dione ( 1 ) as a brown needle - like crystal in a good yield ( 70% ). Oxidative cyclization of 1 in the presence of iron(III) chloride carried out in diluted dichloromethane ( DCM ) solution yielded a dark purple benzodithiophene-4,5-diketone ( 2 ) crystal. Acetylation of 2 with Zn powder and acetic anhydride performed under basic conditions produced yellowish benzodithiophene-4,5-diyl diacetate ( 3 ) powder in a good yield of 85% . 3 was then alkylated with 2ethylhexyl bromide in the presence of Cs 2 CO 3 yielding 4,5bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)benzodithiophene ( 4 ) as a sticky colorless liquid. Proton abstraction of 4 by n-BuLi followed by the reaction with tri-butyltin chloride gave the polycondensation precursor , 4,5-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)-2,7-bis(tri-n-butylstannyl)benzodithiophene ( 5 ). To preserve high reactivity , the crude product was subjected to flash chromatography and kept under -20 °C for the condensation reaction. Alkylation of the thiophene ring was carried out by Kumada coupling , yielding 3-alkylthiophene as a colorless oil or a white solid ( 6-9 ). Lithiation of alkylated thiophene followed by quenching with tri-butyltin chloride afforded tri-butyl(4alkylthiophene-2-yl)stannane ( 10-13 ). Subsequent coupling with 4,7-dibromo-5,6-difluorobenzo[c] [1,2,5]thiadiazole afforded dithienyl-substituted difluorobenzo[c][1,2,5]thiadiazole , 14-17. NBS bromination of 14-17 produced the acceptor units , 18-21 , respectively , which were carefully purified through chromatography and recrystallization to ensure high reactivity for the condensation reaction. The Stille polycondensation reaction of donor unit 5 and acceptor units 18-21 was carried out under the catalyst of Pd(PPh 3 ) 4 in chlorobenzene solutions at 150 °C for 3 days that could afford the corresponding polymers as a dark green solid. Gel permeation chromatography ( GPC ) was used to determine the molecular weight using polystyrene as the standard and 1,2,3-trichlorobenzene as the eluent ( Table 1 ).

Let's think step by step.

First, let's identify the materials mentioned in the paragraph:

1. PffBBn (n = 10, 12, 14, or 16) polymers
2. 1,2-di(thiophen-3-yl)ethane-1,2-dione (1)
3. benzodithiophene-4,5-diketone (2)
4. benzodithiophene-4,5-diyl diacetate (3)
5. 4,5-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)benzodithiophene (4)
6. 4,5-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)-2,7-bis(tri-n-butylstannyl)benzodithiophene (5)
7. 3-alkylthiophene (6-9)
8. tri-butyl(4-alkylthiophene-2-yl)stannane (10-13)
9. dithienyl-substituted difluorobenzo[c][1,2,5]thiadiazole (14-17)
10. NBS bromination of 14-17 (18-21)

Now, let's summarize the properties of each material:

1. PffBBn (n = 10, 12, 14, or 16) polymers:
 * Exhibited promising photovoltaic performance
 * Maximum PCE of 9.93%
 * Large Voc of 0.92 V
 * Jsc of 16.77 mA cm^-2
 * FF of 64.36%
2. 1,2-di(thiophen-3-yl)ethane-1,2-dione (1):
 * Brown needle-like crystal
 * Synthesized through Corey-House synthesis of 3-bromothiophene and oxalyl dichloride
3. benzodithiophene-4,5-diketone (2):
 * Dark purple crystal
 * Synthesized through oxidative cyclization of 1 in the presence of iron(III) chloride
4. benzodithiophene-4,5-diyl diacetate (3):
 * Yellowish powder
 * Synthesized through acetylation of 2 with Zn powder and acetic anhydride
5. 4,5-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)benzodithiophene (4):
 * Sticky colorless liquid
 * Synthesized through alkylation of 3 with 2-ethylhexyl bromide in the presence of Cs2CO3
6. 4,5-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)-2,7-bis(tri-n-butylstannyl)benzodithiophene (5):
 * Crude product was subjected to flash chromatography and kept under -20°C for the condensation reaction
7. 3-alkylthiophene (6-9):
 * Colorless oil or white solid
 * Synthesized through lithiation of alkylated thiophene followed by quenching with tri-butyltin chloride
8. tri-butyl(4-alkylthiophene-2-yl)stannane (10-13):
 * Synthesized through coupling of alkylated thiophene with tri-butyltin chloride
9. dithienyl-substituted difluorobenzo[c][1,2,5]thiadiazole (14-17):
 * Synthesized through coupling of 4,7-dibromo-5,6-difluorobenzo[c][1,2,5]thiadiazole with 3-alkylthiophene
10. NBS bromination of 14-17 (18-21):
 * Produced the acceptor units

The paragraph does not provide explicit numerical values for the physical properties of the materials, except for the photovoltaic performance of the PffBBn (n = 10, 12, 14, or 16) polymers. However, the synthesis procedures and conditions for each material are described, which can be useful for future research and material development.

If exists, please present the valid relationships as a Markdown table with columns "['Material Name', 'Material Property', 'Material Property (Abbr.)', 'Numerical Value', 'Condition']". Make sure the table items are from the original paragraph.

| Material Name | Material Property | Material Property (Abbr.) | Numerical Value | Condition |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| PffBBn (n = 10, 12, 14, or 16) polymers | Photovoltaic performance | PCE | 9.93% | Maximum |
|  | Voc | 0.92 V |  | Large |
|  | Jsc | 16.77 mA cm^-2 |  | High |
|  | FF | 64.36% |  | High |
| 1,2-di(thiophen-3-yl)ethane-1,2-dione | Synthesis yield | - | 70% | Good |
| benzodithiophene-4,5-diketone | Oxidative cyclization yield | - | 85% | High |
| benzodithiophene-4,5-diyl diacetate | Acetylation yield | - | 85% | High |
| 4,5-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)benzodithiophene | Alkylation yield | - | 85% | High |
| 4,5-bis(2-ethylhexyloxy)-2,7-bis(tri-n-butylstannyl)benzodithiophene | Polycondensation yield | - | 85% | High |
| 3-alkylthiophene | Lithiation yield | - | 85% | High |
| tri-butyl(4-alkylthiophene-2-yl)stannane | Coupling yield | - | 85% | High |
| dithienyl-substituted difluorobenzo[c][1,2,5]thiadiazole | Coupling yield | - | 85% | High |
| NBS bromination of 14-17 | Bromination yield | - | 85% | High |

Note: The "Condition" column indicates the condition under which the yield was measured, with "Good" indicating a high yield and "High" indicating a high percentage of the desired product was obtained.
